properties.name: ArrowFight Multiplayer
properties.description:
A player vs player platformer game where up to 4 players or bots fire arrows at each other in order to be the last player left.

Controls:

Move
- Arrow keys
- Left-stick of gamepad
- D-pad on gamepad
- Left virtual joystick (mobile)

Jump (and Double Jump)
- Up arrow
- Up on left-stick of gamepad
- Up on D-pad of gamepad
- Up on left virtual joystick (mobile)

Aiming
- Left-Click and mouse cursor
- Right-stick of gamepad
- Right virtual joystick (mobile)

Fire arrow (while aiming):
- Release left-click on mouse
- Right-Bumper or Right-Trigger on gamepad
- Release right virtual joystick (mobile)

This game example includes:
-Multiplayer lobby
-Platformer behavior
-Screen wrap behavior
-Sound effects
-Resource bars
-Forces

events.name: Setting owners and colors of instances of Player, ArrowBar, and Score objects

events.comment: Setting ownership if there are multiple players in the game
Setting up Bot objects if there is only one player in the game
Setting owner for Score and creating ArrowBars
Mouse
Gamepad
Virtual joystick
Position and quantity of ArrowBar
Player arrow interactions
Pick up arrows
Creating an arrow
Rotate the arrow
Fire the arrow
Kill player if hit (and stick the player to the arrow)
Stop arrows when they hit a wall
Bot movement
Bot arrow interaction
Bot death
If a player joins
Player death
Restart the scene if only 1 player remains

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BehaviorRemapper
description: Make sure to disable default controls unless you want two keys to do the same action.
Actions have two versions. `custom` allow the movement keys to be changed to what ever you would like. `presets` provide a common key-bindings that can be selected from a list.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers).
- automatic mappers for platformer characters and top-down movement
The Bomberman-like example handles 4 players with gamepads ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://goose-bomberman)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
- Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Pass the configuration to the behavior (MaxValue must be set before Value).

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport object when it moves off the screen and immediately appear on the opposite side while maintaining speed and trajectory.
description: The teleport happens when the center point of the object crosses a border (this can be adjusted with an offset).
By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can also be changed.
The Asteroid-like example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://space-asteroids)).

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedJump
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Sports and Fitness/Sports and Fitness_training_running_run.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Let platformer characters: air jump, wall jump wall sliding, coyote time and dashing.
description: * Do coyote time, also known as "ledge tolerance". It lets players jumping even after their character is no longer touching the ground for a given amount of time. It aims to give players a feeling of control and reduce frustration.
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-moves)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump shortly after leaving a platform and also jump in mid-air.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AdvancedJump

events.comment: Avoid any side effect if the feature is not used.
The timeframe is starting.
The timeframe is missed.
Coyote jump
The new value will be used next frame.
While in the coyote jump frame, the Object is treated as being on the floor. No air jump can happen.
When the object fall, it doesn't jump but air jumps must be allowed

The order of these events is important because the idle state is:
on the floor and jump key released but the 1st jump must not count.
Reset air jump counter.
Allow air jumps.
Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the coyote time duration of an object (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetCoyoteTime

events.comment: Coyote time was disabled, so WasInTheAir may not have been updated for a long time.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let platformer characters jump and slide against walls.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: WallJump

events.comment: Avoid a jump from the floor to do a wall jump because of the allowed timeframe.
Reset default character configuration when a jump that is not a wall jump happens (for instance an air jump).
To know when jumping from the floor or not.
Reset default character configuration when the character change of direction or start to fall.
When the character tries to move but can't actually move, it's against a wall.
Save the previous position for the wall detection.

To be permissive, when the jump key was pressed right before the character touch the wall,
it is still detected as a wall jump which reset the air jump counter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.
